meanings.definition: To shape or form in advance.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys preshaping the clay before starting her pottery project.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter is preshaping the wood to make it easier to carve later.
meanings.sent3: The preschool teacher preshaped the playdough into funny animal shapes for the kids.
meanings.sent4: His careful planning was like preshaping the future of his business.
meanings.sent5: Preshaping the dough into small balls helps in making perfectly round cookies.

meanings.definition: The act of shaping or forming in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preshaping of the metal was crucial before the final assembly of the parts.
meanings.sent2: The preshaping of the clay helped the artist create intricate sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The preshaping of the cake layers made them look like miniature hills.
meanings.sent4: The preshaping of the story in his mind made writing the novel much easier.
meanings.sent5: The preshaping of the garden beds gave them a neat and organized appearance.
